Future<void> setPlayerOptionInString( {required String key, required String value});
public abstract int SetPlayerOption(string key, string value);

section.p: The media player allows you to set options using key and value. The difference between this method and is that the value in this method is of type String, while in , the value is of type Int. These two methods cannot be used interchangeably.

The media player allows you to set options using key and value. The difference between this method and is that this method uses a String type for value, while uses an Int type. The two cannot be used interchangeably.

section.title: Scenario
section.p: Scenarios where technical preview or customized features are needed. In general, you don't need to call this method; the default media player option settings are sufficient.

section.title: Return Values

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
< 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
